author: daxian-dbw
body:
The support for `dynamic` and `ComBinder` was added by https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/33060 and shipped in .NET 5 preview.2.
We should refresh the code under `src\System.Management.Automation\engine\ComInterop` with the code from [dotnet/runtime](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/tree/ac219a0b106b380c7946eb2c6c1f4b182b39e43a/src/libraries/Microsoft.CSharp/src/Microsoft/CSharp/RuntimeBinder/ComInterop) and enable `ComBnder` code path in our binders.

`ComBinder` will significantly speed up COM interop in PowerShell. See the reference issue: https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/36944

comments.author: skippernl
comments.body:
Follow up on dotnet/runtime#36944

The script `Fortigate2Excel.ps1` can be found at https://github.com/skippernl/Fortigate2Excel, and a testing configuration file was added to the [onedrive link](https://onedrive.live.com/?authkey=%21ABU9qmGX7uNy1iM&id=208A52F3904C2E29%21123706&cid=208A52F3904C2E29).

To test, run `.\Fortigate2Excel.ps1 .\PerfTest_20200526_0942.conf`

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body:

title: Refresh and enable the 'ComBinder' code in PowerShell
